Package ohos.agp.components.webengine

Class WebView

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.webengine.WebView

  • public class WebView
extends Component
    Represents a component that has the web page access capability.

    This class is inherited from Component and contains all capabilities of the basic component. This component can be used to load web page content, obtain page details, and control page jumping. You can also use Data abilities to load local web page files.

    Since:
    5

      • load

        public void load​(String url)
        Loads the given web page linked by a specified URL. The URL supports network protocols such as HTTP and HTTPS, and also supports the scheme "dataability", for loading local files.
        Parameters:
        url - Indicates the URL to load.
        Since:
        5

      • load

        public void load​(String data,
                 String mimeType,
                 boolean isBase64Encoded)
        Loads data strings to a WebView object.

        If you need to avoid the JavaScript same-origin policy, use the load(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) method instead.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the data to be loaded. The value cannot be null. If the data is not encoded using Base64, ensure that all characters in the data string comply with the URL specifications.
        mimeType - Indicates the MIME type of the data. If the value is null, text/html is used by default.
        isBase64Encoded - Specifies whether the data is encoded using Base64.
        Since:
        5

      • load

        public void load​(String data,
                 String mimeType,
                 String encodingName,
                 String baseUrl,
                 String virtualUrl)
        Loads the data schema to the WebView object with the base URL and virtual URL specified.

        When the data schema is used by the base URL, data must be URL or Base64 encoded. Otherwise, the data will be loaded as a pure character string and the URL-encoded entity will not be decoded.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the data to be loaded. The value cannot be null.
        mimeType - Indicates the MIME type of the data. If the value is null, text/html is used by default.
        encodingName - Indicates the data encoding format. The value cannot be null.
        baseUrl - Indicates the base URL for loading data. The value may be null. The default value is about:blank.
        virtualUrl - Indicates the URL displayed to users, which may be null. The default value is about:blank. This parameter is valid only when the data schema is not used by the base URL.
        Since:
        5

      • post

        public void post​(String url,
                 byte[] data)
        Sends a POST request to a specified URL. If the URL does not support the POST request, this method is treated as the load(java.lang.String) method.
        Parameters:
        url - Indicates the URL for loading. The value cannot be null.
        data - Indicates the data content for the POST request. The value must be encoded using application/x-www-form-urlencoded and cannot be null.
        Since:
        5

      • pageDown

        public boolean pageDown​(boolean isToBottom)
        Scrolls down a web page.
        Parameters:
        isToBottom - Indicates whether to scroll a web page to its bottom. Value true indicates scroll-down to the bottom of the web page; value false indicates scroll-down to the half height of the web page.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the page is scrolled down to its bottom; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • pageUp

        public boolean pageUp​(boolean isToTop)
        Scrolls up the web page.
        Parameters:
        isToTop - Specifies whether to scroll a web page to its top. Value true indicates scroll-up to the top of the web page; value false indicates scroll-up to the half height of the web page.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the page is scrolled up to its top; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • canScroll

        public boolean canScroll​(int direction,
                         int distance)
        Checks whether the WebView content can be scrolled by the specified distance in the horizontal or vertical direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - Indicates the X-axis or Y-axis direction. Component#AXIS_X indicates the X-axis direction (horizontal), and Component#AXIS_Y indicates the Y-axis direction (vertical).
        distance - Indicates the offset distance in the specified direction. A negative value indicates upward or leftward, and a positive value indicates downward or rightward.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the WebView content can be scrolled by the specified distance in the given direction; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • setVisibility

        public void setVisibility​(int visibility)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Sets the visibility of a component.

        When the parameter value is Component.VISIBLE, the component occupies space and needs to be rendered. When the parameter value is Component.INVISIBLE, the component occupies space but does not need to be rendered. When the parameter value is Component.HIDE, the component occupies no space and does not need to be rendered.

        Overrides:
        setVisibility in class Component
        Parameters:
        visibility - The value is one of the following: Component.VISIBLE, Component.INVISIBLE, or Component.HIDE.

      • requestFocus

        public boolean requestFocus​()
        Description copied from class: Component
        Requests focus for the current component or one of its child components.

        A component will not be able to actually take focus in any of the following situations: the component is not focusable (Component.isFocusable() returns false); or the component is not focusable in touch mode (Component.isTouchFocusable() returns false); or the component is invisible, disabled, or has not acquired space for drawing.

        Overrides:
        requestFocus in class Component
        Returns:
        Returns true if the component or one of its child components has taken focus; returns false otherwise.

      • executeLongClick

        public boolean executeLongClick​()
        Description copied from class: Component
        Performs a long-click event in a component.

        This method calls the OnLongClickListener created for the component. Observers registered by the Component.setLongClickedListener(ohos.agp.components.Component.LongClickedListener) method will be notified. After the callback is executed, the system passes a lifting event to the long-click event listener.

        Overrides:
        executeLongClick in class Component
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback function is executed successfully.
